## arrayIterator() function

Returns iterator of nullable array w/ optional index range support and/or reverse iteration order. The default range covers the entire array.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function arrayIterator<T>(buf: Nullable<ArrayLike<T>>, start?: number, end?: number): Generator<T, void, unknown>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  buf | <code>Nullable&lt;ArrayLike&lt;T&gt;&gt;</code> | array or null |
|  start | <code>number</code> | start index |
|  end | <code>number</code> | end index (excluded) |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Generator<T, void, unknown>`

## Remarks

If `start` &gt; `end`<!-- -->, yields values in reverse order. No bounds checking is performed.
